evidence suggests that a 
mother who is HIV positive, 
in good health and without 
symptoms of the infection, 
is unlikely to be adversely 
affected	by	pregnancy.	
However the HIV virus can 
be passed on to the baby 
during pregnancy and 
through breastmilk, but with
